course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Technology and Innovation: Social and Business Perspectives
course.description: This course describes the development of technology and innovation from social and business perspectives.  It covers the technology side of innovations, how an invention can be developed into a successful commercial product, the role of innovation in society and how innovations are created from a socioeconomic perspective.  It highlights that successful development and adoption of innovative products relies not only on the technology itself but also a complex process that is subject to the impact of cultural, political, economic and managerial factors.

reviews.author: dankmemes
reviews.title: Huge Workload and Grading was absolutely terrible
reviews.comment_content:
The content was pretty good, mostly about innovation and technology etc
Would be quite interesting to people who are interested in tech companies/ innovation
reviews.comment_teaching: Not too much to say, very interactive in general
reviews.comment_grading:
ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!!!

15% class parti
30% midterm exam
15% group project presentation
25% group project report
15% individual paper

My scores:
exam: 86/100 (1.6 S.D. above)
group report: 24.6/25
group present: 14/15
term paper: 12.3/15
class parti: 3.9/15 (even though I participated at least 5 times in class and once on the discussion board, email the prof and he said it was infrequent)

Ended up getting a C+. absolutely devastated

So no matter how much effort you put into the course (for exam, report etc), you have to participate in almost every single lesson or else you will end up screwing your grade as I did > quite unfair I would say
reviews.comment_workload:
Huge workload for a common core course

For class parti: you have to participate very frequently, basically every single class unless you wanna screw up your grade

The midterm exam covers a lot of content so a lot of work on that

Group project was standard but still quite time consuming tbh

The individual paper only accounts for 15% of your grade but you have to write a 2500 words essay. LOL

reviews.author: bacbac
reviews.title: Good Course with super horrible TA, if not the worst TA ever
reviews.comment_content: Content is interesting, this course will provide a broad perspective about technology and innovation. Although if you're aiming for good grade & are probably engineering students, you should take other SSC course. But, if you're here just for fun, I'd recommend taking this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor teaches very well, he understands how to teach in an interesting way. Although I don't want to exaggerate, his class is one of not many classes in which I don't fall asleep during the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: Prof gives a very good grading.However, TA is horrible, if not sucks. TA sticks to the grading scheme 1000000000% without even considering any other possible correct answer that is similar or also correct. Again, if I have to give reason why I gave D for grading, professor gives A for grading, which is very kind & lenient, however TA gives F------ grading which doesn't make sense. IE. if the answer why Apple falls is because of gravity, TA wouldn't accept that Apple falls because of Earth's pulling force. Again, avoid this course if you don't like to memorize tons of stuffs exactly word by word. TA will kill you 1000000%.
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty low workload, fair enough for common core.

reviews.author: Carmen0401
reviews.title: Poor Grading
reviews.comment_content:
Some real-life examples about technology innovations and how companys like apple, google, amazon promote themselves in different ways.
The content is very interesting and useful as you would analyze the internal policy of those successful companies.
reviews.comment_teaching: The slides are quite simple and clean. The professor leaves much time for asking us questions and discussing with us. The class is very interactive and easy to catch up with.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very poor. I attended 90%+ classes and answered questions in around 2/3 classes. It turns out my class participation is only half of the full score.
Both of my mid-term and final are above mean.
My group project is about mean which is almost full score.
At the end, my grade is C+.......
I don't quite understanding. Maybe too competitive TAT
reviews.comment_workload:
A group project is writing a report to analyze a disruptive technology or company. You also need to write a report on a similar topic on your own. At the end of the semester, the workload could be high.

For the group project, I'm the only year 1 student in the group so my groupmates are tolerant and willing to guide me. Turns out the project grade is quite good.

reviews.author: smallpotato tom
reviews.title: good grade CC but workload was a bit demanding in Winter
reviews.comment_content:
8 chapters in total:

1. Innovation Types and Technology S-curves & Cycle
2. Dominant Design and Network Effects
3. Chicken-and-Egg Problem
4. Platform Competition and Winner-take-all-market
5. Innovation Experimentation
6. Open Innovation and Crowdsourcing
7. Disruptive Innovation I
8. Disruptive Innovation II

Quite interesting and inspiring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Kim is a good guy. His voice is attractive. He is passionate in answering students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
There was a special arrangement in this semester:

Self-introduction on Canvas - 1%
Class Attendance - 7%
Class Participation - 2%
Assignment - 10%
Group Project - 35%
Quiz (after each lesson) - 10%
Final Exam - 35%

My Stat:
Full marks in Self-introduction, Class Attendance, Class Participation and Assignment, 95% in Quiz, 91.4% in Project (mean is 84.3%), 85% in Final Exam (mean is 80.3%), got an A-.

Fair grading. Not that "hard" to get A range and B range.
reviews.comment_workload:
In this semester, we had lessons using Zoom.

We used 9-10 hours weekly to have online lecture during Winter. It's a suffering.

Group project (5 people in a group) used around 1-2 days to be completed. You can choose to present it by either writing a report, or recording your presentation (in this semester).

Final exam is open-book but obviously most people don't have enough time to complete all questions.

We had 2 MC questions after each lesson on Canvas. Quite easy.

You need to attend all lessons for Class Attendance. (login Zoom in this semester)

reviews.author: gossipgirl
reviews.comment_content: The content is very useful and interesting... Definitely get to learn quite a few key terms and ideas... Might get a little bored during some topics (dragged for a long time)...
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is really good and interactive. The professor knows how to make the class interesting and his slides are one of the best parts about the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course can get you an A range grade... But the final really changes what you might be expecting during the semester. Doing well in the final (mean + sd) would get you an A..if you have mean+sd  in all scores.

The TA grades the papers and is horrible at it. Absolutely unwilling to use any common sense and marks strictly based on the marking scheme the professor sets.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair amount of workload... Project requires around 3-4 weeks to discuss and implement..

reviews.author: Bowen97
reviews.comment_content: The content is often vague and broad.  You can expect no concrete theories or concepts.  In another sense, this is a course extremely easy to understand
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very nice and helpful in delivering the content.  He is a very good teacher.  Though I didn't find his gags funny.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is pretty nice, even though I do not have my exam score back.  The final exam is 99% multiple-choice questions, only the last one is a fill-in-blank question.  You can say the professor is being lazy.  Questions are all easy, straight-forward and required you to memorise the contents on the lecture notes.  I got A eventually.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light, only a group project is required and no homework assigned.  I didn't even meet my group mates but so how we managed to put up a presentation about tech innovation.

reviews.author: Audrey.C
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly theories and concepts with a lot of examples.
Lectures were long(around  3.5 hours) but quite interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The prof is kind and funny,
He managed the time quite well that he gave us breaks. If he forgot to do so, the lesson will be ended earlier, like nearly an hour.
reviews.comment_grading:
Final: 60%
Presentation(Group project): 25%
Peer evaluation: 10%
Random attendance(not every lesson): 5%
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light: just final and a group project.
Groupmates of the group project were randomly assigned, which was about 6/7 students in a group.
The presentation regarding the group project will be about 10 mins.

reviews.author: mdj857
reviews.title: review
reviews.comment_content: Because this was a summer course, lectures were long but it wasn't so bad because professot made lots of jokes.  The content was very interesting and we learned several examples in class like Google, IBM, and Uber. I'd say this is one of the most interesting course I've taken
reviews.comment_teaching: Very funny guy--kept class engaged even though lectures were terribly long
reviews.comment_grading:
5% attendance
10% peer evaluation
25% group project
60% final exam
reviews.comment_workload: workload was very light. Just a group project and a final, but make sure you come to class.

reviews.author: Ahzzzz
reviews.title: To my teammates, thank you
reviews.comment_content:
1. The Importance and Sources of Technological Innovation
2. Patterns and Dynamics of Technological Innovation
3. Standards Battles and Network Externalities
4. Timing of Entry
5. Role of Complementors
6. Open Innovation
7. Implementing Technological Innovation Strategy: Organizing for Innovation
8. A Few Myths of Innovation

Materials overall are easy and understandable.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. tries to engage us into the lectures with a story-telling style. Just that I find his jokes and stories may sometimes be a little dull. Still, he is a passionate lecturer and deserves respect.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
Final Exam: 50%
Group Presentation: 25%
Peer Evaluation: 20%
Class Attendance: 5%

Final letter grade: A+

Neither marks nor statistics are disclosed.
My personal suggestion to get good grades:
1. For group presentation, try to find a less-known company focusing on a less-trended industry.
2. Attends every lecture. He takes attendance almost every time (which he claims to be occasionally)
3. Final exam is just MC and short questions, be sure that you are familiar with the concepts.
4. Get allocated/find good teammates. Huge thanks to my teammates for carrying me. Hope you guys do well in the future.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost no workload except the group presentation which is about 12 minutes. You will have more than enough time to finish the group project.

If you have not much to do during summer break, attending this course maybe a good choice to fill up your time and gain some easy credits.

reviews.author: MH army
reviews.title: Common core course with light workload
reviews.comment_content:
1 Sep 2 Introduction to Course  
2 Sep 7 Innovation Evolution and S-Curves    
3 Sep 9 Patterns of Innovation in Different Industries  
4 Sep 14 Innovation Adoption  
5 Sep 16 Technology Ethics  
6 Sep 21 Innovation and the Impact on Labor Market Form groups
7 Sep 23 Protecting Innovation: Patents  
8 Sep 28 Protecting Innovation: Copyrights, Trademarks and
Trade-secrets
9 Sep 30 Promoting Innovation: The Role of Public Policy  
10 Oct 5 Organizing for Innovation Get instructor’s
approval for topics
11 Oct 7 Review for mid-term examination    
Oct 12 MID TERM EXAM  
12 Oct 14 Disruptive Innovations  
13 Oct 19 Analyzing Innovation Capabilities  
14 Oct 21 Finding Innovative Ideas  
15 Oct 26 Developing Innovations  
16 Oct 28 Agile Development -Scrum  
17 Nov 2 Lead User Innovation  
18 Nov 4 Open Innovation
19 Nov 9 Crowdsourcing
20 Nov 11 Project consultation
21 Nov 16 PROJECT PRESENTATIONS
22 Nov 18 PROJECT PRESENTATIONS
23 Nov 23 PROJECT PRESENTATIONS
24 Nov 25 Review for final examination
Divided into 3 sections, introduction and innovation basics, innovation and society, developing and managing innovation
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor teaches quite well and is engaging with students. The slides are also clean and easy to understand. Even if you miss some lectures, catching up is easy. The course material and examples can be quite interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% class participation
20% midterm exam
30% group project (10% presentation, 20% report)
40% final exam
Grading is decent, participation marks can be attained by answering questions in class or discussion in canvas. Attendance is not counted.
Midterm and final are closed book but not particularly difficult. First half of the questions are understanding of the course material, second half is essay questions similar to LS in DSE. Final exam is not cumulative.
Group project involves analysing the innovation process in a company of choice using concepts in the course. Group has to present for 10 minutes with slides and submit a 15 page report.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy, most work is at the later part of the course in the form of the project. Not all groupmates are required in the presentation. Revising concepts before exams should not take too much time.

reviews.author: Talhahk
reviews.title: Easy A range. (Comparably to other courses)
reviews.comment_content: Content isn't very special. You would studying about stuff you had already studied in ISOM 2010 but with more examples and case studies.
reviews.comment_teaching: Yongsuk is a great professor. No strong accent, monotonous voice or reading the slides. He keeps his students interested through questions and interesting examples, replies you within hours, and appreciate humour.
reviews.comment_grading: Got my first A+ in this course. You will be required to do 2 projects (30%), 5 random in class quizzes (5%), an in class game (3%), and final exam (50%). Attendance and participation are important as they have around 12% weightage.
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty chill

reviews.author: Gaylary
reviews.title: Group projects is a HUUUGE MATTER
reviews.comment_content: It will be a bit boring if you are a fast learner because the theories are simple but have many examples. But I guess that's what matters--- you need to analyze real-life examples with those theories. You really need to attend lectures as the professor gave very thorough analyses of the example or there is little chance you can figure out all examples yourselves.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Interesting and quite chill in class
Though there is participation and attendance taken into grading, normally you won't be worried about them, you don't have to speak much to get a full mark.
Prof.Kim replied email timely and gave feedback on group work. But it will be better if there are some model projects that we can learn from.
reviews.comment_grading:
Though I got 87 in the final (mean 67 highest 90 if I remember correctly), IT WON'T MAKE UP IF YOU SCORE BAD IN GRP PROJECT...I STILL GOT B... SERIOUSLY, DON'T TAKE THIS COURSE IF YOU CAN'T HANDLE WORKING IN GROUPS.
I consulted the professor, and he said the group project mean in people who've got an A is 40.6 out of 43!!!!! You literally need to get all full marks in all 3 group work to have an A.
ONE piece of advice: choose your teammate WISELY! There is an introduction part where you can literally choose some project carrier. Be proactive and reach out. That's how you can get a good grade in group projects.
reviews.comment_workload: For a 3-week common core course, the workload is surprisingly low. There are only 2 group projects that you need to make PPT and presentation. It will be very easy if you have all 5 members on board!! We've got 2 free-riders but were able to finish it anyway.

reviews.author: Dicaprio
reviews.title: Nice Common Core Course
reviews.comment_content:
This course talks about what innovation is and what platform is. S1~S8: Zoom lectures, S9: GW2 Simulation, S10: GW3 Presentations (no need attendance), S11: Final exam

All Zoom lectures but attendance and participation is needed. You need to actively ask/answer questions in Zoom chat in order to get those points. There is also a simple quiz after most lectures to see if you learn anything from the lecture.

You need to form a group of 5~6 people yourselves to do the 2 powerpoint presentations with voice narration. You also need to play a simulation in class with your groupmates. If you think your groupmates are free-riders, you can depart from your team and be a one man team. (there are 2 one man teams this semester)
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches quite good. People really ask and answer too many questions during the lectures.(maybe because of the points) There will be two 10~15 minutes breaks in between the 3.5 hours lecture so I don't feel exhausted during the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
1% self introduction (before S2)
-reply to a Canvas discussion about who you are in order to help you form your groups.

8% attendance
- late: -0.5%, no show: -1%

3% participation
- based on your contribution on other's learning experience, not the numbers of words written/spoken

10% quiz (S2, S3, S5, S6, S8)
-5 canvas quiz, 2 MC each. attendance 1%, correct answer 0.5%.

15% GW1 (due S7)
-6 minutes PowerPoint presentation with voice over narration, (around 1 week to finish it)
-Peer and Self evaluation after the final exam

3% GW2 (S9 in class simulation)
-Strategic Innovaton Simulaton: Back Bay Batery, 4% best team, 3% total profit>=$200M, 2% survived till the end, 1% fired. (Google/YouTube it before to find the tips to win this)

25% GW3 (due S10)
-10 minutes PowerPoint presentation with voice over narration/present live on S10, (around 1 week to finish it) (only group 1&2 presented live, there are 16 groups)
-Peer and Self evaluation after the final exam

35% Final exam (S11)
Open book, open notes, can Google, cannot go back to last question, no break in between, 2 hours long Canvas exam on Zoom breakout rooms without focus mode.
-34 T/F, Multiple Choices, Multiple Answers questions. (2.5 points each)
-3 open ended long questions (5 points each)

My grades:
Self introduction: ?/1 (I guess 1/1)
Attendance: ?/8 (I guess 8/8)
Class Participation: ?/3 (I guess 2/3)
Quizzes: 9.5/10
GW1: 14/15 (mean: 12.2, max: 15)
GW2: 3/3 (mean: 2.4, max: 4)
GW3: 24/25 (mean: 21.6, max: 26)
Final Exam: 28.455/35 (Converted to x/35)
-Exam Score: 81.3/100 (mean: 67.3, max: 90.7)
-MC: 67.3/85 (mean: 58.4, max: 77.7)
-LQ: 14/15 (mean: 8, max: 15)

Total: 85~90/100 (I guess)
Grade: A+

The score of GW3 and the final grade are released quite late (on 29~30/8) but this is a cc course with good grades so this isn't a problem.😀
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate workload. You need to finish a group presentation with your groupmates in 1 week. So, you need to start doing it early in order to finish it on time. (day 1~2: brainstorm ideas, day 3~5: make the slides, day 6~7: record your voice into the PowerPoint, and then repeat it again next week) Imagine you have a free-rider in your team, your workload will be huge.

You also need to focus in the real time zoom lecture. The questions and answers in the Zoom chat changes very quickly... (yes/no x40 people immediately in zoom chat when professor ask question...)

reviews.author: stephy
reviews.comment_content: Interesting and useful, easy to understand
reviews.comment_teaching:
the professor is really nice and friendly, and would take any suggestions or opinions from students into consideration.
Related videos or materials are prepared beforehand to boost the interest of students.
He encourages both class discussion and after class online discussion on several topics to establish a more solid foundation of knowledge of innovation to us.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was fair enough, students in average got a B range
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignment No essay No quiz
Only mid term and final exams, and by the end of the semester,  a report has to be done by 5 people in a group and a 15 mins of presentation is needed.

reviews.author: troll
reviews.title: Very good course with good grading and little workload
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting models explained with many examples that are easy to understand and memorize. The content is useful in business and related to our daily life.

The PPT are well prepared and you could basically study all of the PPT and readings(not too much) which will be enough for your exam.

Kim will take attendance randomly and you will have one chance to miss it. Kind enough.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is very good and he is a nice person. He tried to interact with us so don't be shy to answer questions in class as this could help scoring high in the class participation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is super good. Please don't hesitate to register this course.

Take the following as a reference: http://www.bm.ust.hk/~isom/course/syllabus/1380_1516Fall.pdf
reviews.comment_workload:
Reading and PPT are not heavy and if you pay attention in class, you won't have any problem in memorizing it one or two days before the examination. You will have a simulation which accounts for 3 percent.

No homework is needed and the exams are just easy essays. some MC and T/F and short questions.

You will finish a project in a group of 6 - 7 for 14 mins and a final report. The present is about an innovation and you could choose any you like. The shared workload is small.

reviews.author: Davidcwh
reviews.comment_content:
The course covered materials mainly about technology and innovation. Many models were taught with the support of real cases, which were applicable in business world.

There was an online platform for students to communicate and read the course materials. Sometimes professor would pose a topic for discussion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Kim was very passionate about the topic and he encouraged lots of discussions among the classmates.

He would like to spend his own time to talk with students about things beyond the course materials.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good enough, the amount of effort put in the course was reflected by the grade.

Participation meant quite a lot in the course, actively participate in the course would be very beneficial for the grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
There was no homework for the class, read the materials before the class and joined the discussion in class would be enough.

There was a group project in this course, the topic could be selected by the students. Most of the workloads come from the project.  The project was mainly divided into Proposal, Mid-term Review, Presentation and Final Report.

reviews.author: cookiemonster
reviews.comment_content: Content is very interesting and meaningful. Professor includes modern day examples to keep things applicable.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Jeevan is a great professor who uses various media to teach, including in class activities and experiments, and group discussions. Additionally, he fosters creativity and motivates students to voice their different opinions through debates.
reviews.comment_grading: Since this course is relatively easy to do well in, the mean and SD are generally quite high. Hence, one has to do excellently to get an A.
reviews.comment_workload: There is a mid-term and final exam, but in-class participation is important to get a good grade. Alternatively if a student is shy, they have the option of posting on the Wiki forum. This way, introverts and extroverts both get a chance to get the full participation marks. The Wiki discussions are responses to a general question the Professor asks regarding what was learnt in class. Additionally, a group project+presentation is required for the course.

reviews.author: michael
reviews.comment_content:
You will learn several concepts to better understand the nature of technological innovations( switching cost, network externality)

You will learn what to consider to achieve successful innovations (different analysis methodologies like porter 5 model ... will be introduced)

Also, you will find many interesting real world examples of technological innovations (Uber, Tesla)
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor did a great job in teaching. Even though the lectures are freakin long (3.5 hours), professor Hong still managed pretty well. He gave us plenty of breaks and funny moments.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't have much to comment on the grading since the grade in summer term tends to be lenient. (rumors said that this course give a lot A range)

Grade scheme Breakdown:
--Class Attendance/Participation: 5%
-- Group Assignment: 35% (peer evaluation 10% included)
--Final Examination: 60%

Back to my case, we do have a pretty interesting presentation on our project.(most of the students were amused by the implication of the innovative technology)

Given that the final was entirely just MC question, I think I excelled exam (pretty easy)

Finally, I got A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Low volume workload; just a presentation + Final exam

I would say that you really have to find an interesting / funny innovation technology for your group project. Considering this is a entry-level lecture with students from different discipline, professor and TA are expecting students to have creativity rather than a comprehensive analysis of the tech.

Remember  "Play the man, not the odds"

reviews.author: 諗唔倒叫乜好
reviews.comment_content:
the content seems interesting, but the lecture started at 9 am, so it was hard to focus, i was sleepy.

1 Introduction, The Importance of Technological Innovations
2 Continue “The Importance of Technological Innovations”
3 Creativity
4 Patterns of Technological Innovations
5 Standards Battles and Network Externalities
6 Continue “Standards Battles and Network Externalities”
7 Timing of Market Entry
8 Defining the Strategic Direction for Technological Innovation
9 Continue “Defining the Strategic Direction…”
10 Open Innovations
reviews.comment_teaching: he is not reading from the ppt, but like storytelling. however, i fail to pay much attention on the lectures since i was too sleepy
reviews.comment_grading:
I cannot see any of my grades, I do not know the marks of my quizzes or projects.
as I slept for many lectures, I probably didn't get good grades on the quizzes, but I don't know what he thinks about my group's performance in the project as I didn't receive any comments or marks.
the only thing I know is my final grade: C+

Quizzes: 30%
Group Presentation: 30%
Group Assignment: 10%
Class Attendance/Participation: 10%
Peer Evaluation: 20%
reviews.comment_workload:
6 quizzes in total, 2 are given the time and date, other 4 are pop-up quizzes during lessons.
the questions are about the content of that lecture.
1 group presentation and 1 group assignment

reviews.author: BIG I
reviews.comment_content:
8 chapters in total:

1. Innovation Types and Technology S-curves & Cycle
2. Dominant Design and Network Effects
3. Chicken-and-Egg Problem
4. Platform Competition and Winner-take-all-market
5. Innovation Experimentation
6. Open Innovation and Crowdsourcing
7. Disruptive Innovation I
8. Disruptive Innovation II
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice Professor. Making the class interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
You could earn an A- or B- on the course. However, the final significantly alters what you could have anticipated throughout the semester. If your final score was above average (mean + sd), you would receive an A.

The TA is terrible at grading the papers. Absolute refusal to utilize any common sense, and rigorous adherence to the professor's assigned grading system.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair workload. Just 5 Mc quizzes, two group projects, and a final.

reviews.author: atsbe
reviews.comment_content:
Lots of examples to talk about innovation, which could be tested in in-class quizzes.

1. Introduction: Technology and Innovation: Social and Business Perspectives
2. The Importance and Sources of Technological Innovation
3. Patterns and Dynamics of Technological Innovations
4. Standards Battles and Network Externalities
5. Timing of Entry
6. Defining the Strategic Direction for Technological Innovations
6. Open Innovation
reviews.comment_teaching: He made some jokes in the class to make it not too dull, but still, a lecture for 3 hours is tiring to focus. The main idea could be captured from the ppt slides and some examples not included in the slides would be tested.
reviews.comment_grading:
All the marks are not released.

Quizzes: 30%
Group Presentation: 30%
Group Assignment: 15%
Individual Assignment: 5%
Class Participation/Peer Evaluation: 20%
reviews.comment_workload:
We are assigned to different groups randomly and finish both group assignment and group presentation (in total one grp project with presentation and one grp assignment) with the same group of teammates, so the workload is acceptable as long as you don't have a freerider in your group.

He gave us about one week to finish the individual assignment (an essay), so be careful with the ddl if you got an internship or sth else to work on.

reviews.author: maelstrom
reviews.title: Course with average workload + not bad grading
reviews.comment_content:
Course content: History and some theory about innovation. If you've taken ISOM 2010, should feel familiar.

Final presentation content: choose an innovative company and discuss their innovation, business model, etc
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite boring in my opinion, especially since one lecture is about 3 hours. You can get the main points from the powerpoint slide but definitely listen to some of the examples that he gives because it might come up in the impromptu quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading: Better than what I expected. Since a big portion of the grading scheme is from reading assignment, case assignment, and final presentation, the grade is quite hard to predict. But the prof seems to be fair and kind on the grading based on my experience.
reviews.comment_workload:
Attendance
Impromptu quizzes (make sure you attend every lecture)
2 reading assignments (summarize online article)
1 business case assignment (submit powerpoint slides)
1 final presentation
The case assignment + final presentation are both group project so keep that in mind.

reviews.author: KellyIfntlll
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite interesting. You will know more about innovation with real life examples after taking this course.
however it is quite tiring to have three lectures a week and each lecture takes 3.5 hours.

Lecture content:
1 Introduction, The Importance of Technological Innovations
2 Patterns of Technological Innovations
3 Standards Battles and Network Externalities
4 Continue “Standards Battles and Network Externalities”
5 Defining the Strategic Direction for Technological Innovation
6 Continue “Defining the Strategic Direction...”
7 Open Innovations
8 Open Innovations, Organizing for Innovations
9 Organizing for Innovations, Team Presentations
10 Team Presentations
11 Final Exam
reviews.comment_teaching:
teaching is good.
although the lectures are terribly long, professor makes a lot of jokes and provides a lot of funny videos to help us stay focus.
professor will also give us a 10-20 minutes break every lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
grading scheme:
Class Attendance: 5% (taking attendance randomly)
Peer Evaluation: 10%
Group Assignment: 25% (presentation)
Final Examination: 60% (nearly all MC questions)

since the final exam take a large percentage for the final grade and it is quite easy, you have to study hard and be careful to gain a good grade. i think the overall grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
almost no workload for this course. just attend lectures and prepare for your final. the final consists of nearly all MC questions (with 49 MC & 1 short question).
for the group project, there are around 8-10 people in a group. what you have to do is to introduce an innovative company in front of your class. it's a relatively easy project compare to other courses. Our group only meet once to exchange contact and then prepare for the presentation individually. it only took me a few hours in a day to prepare my part.

reviews.author: JJLai
reviews.title: It is a easy course
reviews.comment_content:
The content is good
but there are too many slides on powerpoint
And each lesson last for 3 hours, and it is quite boring
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite funny and friendly.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading scheme may change depending on the progress of the course
Class Attendance: 5%/5%
Peer Evaluation: ?/10%
Group Assignment: ?/25%
Final Examination: ?/60%

Got a B
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is nearly zero. No homework.
Group Assignment is presenting an innovation company.There were total 8 people in my group. Each of us only need to make two slides and find some information. And the total presentation time is only 10 minutes.

reviews.author: Hyman_ZHAN
reviews.title: Good and interesting course; Need to find good teammates
reviews.comment_content:
The first half mainly focuses on the fall of Nokia and the rise of Apple and discussed what the role of innovation is in different market settings.

The second half mainly focuses on different ways to foster innovation in-house and from the community.

Content is interesting if you are interested in the innovation history of different companies.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Clear instruction. Slides were printed and handed out at the beginning of each class. The instructor's English is pretty good and easy to understand.

I sit on the first row every class so I can hear the instructor very clearly. YMMV.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading overall. Got an A in the end.

There were review sessions before each exam which were super helpful. Also if you follow the Study Guide closely you will be in good shape. I was able to score 90+ in the midterm by doing so.
reviews.comment_workload:
It depends. If your project topic is interesting to you and your groupmates are dependable, you will have a pleasant project experience. Other than the project, I don't think the workload is very heavy.
Find dependable teammates who are easy to work with. Can't stress that enough!

reviews.author: avv
reviews.title: EASY COURSE
reviews.comment_content:
Many have already written about the content. Basically various topics related to Technology and Innovation. Don't expect to learn anything. Most people take this class to satisfy some requirement- either common core or minor etc.

Content is fine and interesting at times as well
reviews.comment_teaching:
Hong Se Joon is a Korean professor who teaches quite well for topics that could otherwise be very boring. He has a great sense of humor and shares many interesting stories to keep students engaged. Understand that this is a winter course and most people are doing it not because of interest, rather necessity. That way the prof makes things bearable

Main challenge in this class is sitting through 3.5 hours of classes 3 times a week. I don't get why it should be longer than 3 hours each class. The content is not hard and most summer classes are around 3 hours. But then you can take your own breaks and go outside to get a coffee or a sandwich lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
Final Exam: 65% ,Attendance: 5 %, Presentation: 20%, Peer Evaluation: 10%

Presentation: It's more about choosing a unique company that is interesting and not something cliched like big tech companies out there. Just make it engaging enough and include some good visuals and a short video clip etc. Each group has 8-9 members, so you can imagine the workload would be very light. Of course it is imp. to have a good group as well

Attendance is not taken every class and can be random. Usually after the 10 min break or even towards the end of class.

The final exam is really easy. If you can go through the lecture slides a few times a day or two before the exam, you shouldn't have much problem getting above 90%. The professor said usually he has a problem assigning grades since most people do well on all the components, so even a few MCs wrong can affect your grade and push it down. Probably that's why many people take this lol
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is low. Just a presentation to prepare for. You have to choose a company and explain why it's innovative etc.

This is a winter class so things are probably a bit different rather than normal semester classes.

reviews.author: Ares
reviews.comment_content:
Included many case studies and innovation related information, e.g. business strategy and types of business.

Not so useful regarding the content and actually not a good course if you want to learn something practical for the future.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Although the teaching and lectures were not too boring, the prof was talking about many unrelated contents which turned out to be very distracting.

I'm very frustrated that any paper checking nor scores were revealed and not available. The professor did not reply to the email regarding paper checking for the final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
The transparency was extremely bad. No one knows anything about the scores for presentation, attendance, nor the final exam. The only thing you would get is a final letter grade without knowing which parts did you perform well or poorly.

My group's presentation was average, wouldn't say it was super good or bad. And, I'm pretty sure I got a full attendance. I went through all of the materials and lectures the day before the final exam and didn't pay attention in class. My grade turned out to be a B+. The S.D. is probably very small that 1-3 m.c. question would cause a sub-grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Basically nothing other than preparing a presentation with another 6-7 groupmates and taking the final exam. I would say some easy 3 credits in terms of workload.

reviews.author: 05liaoh
reviews.title: interesting course with good grades
reviews.comment_content:
7 ppts about the details, impact, and importance of technological innovations
1. importance and sources of innovation
2. patterns and dynamics of innovation
3. standards battle and network externalities
4. timing of entry
5. strategic direction
6. open innovation
7. organization/implementation of innovation
reviews.comment_teaching: the professor is very friendly and passionate about what he teaches. applicable examples make this course enjoyable and interesting
reviews.comment_grading:
pretty good.
presentation: 25%
final: 60%
random attendance: 5%
peer evaluation: 10%
no marks were released but the grading should be pretty good as the final, which is worth 60%, is mostly MCQs with a few fill in the blanks and true/false. I looked over the ppts at the end of every week and also studied a few days before the exam. As for the presentation, my group worked pretty well together and I think we did okay. Final grade was an A.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is manageable. one group presentation (randomly assigned, 6-7 people). most ppts have around 40-50 slides, a couple of them are slightly longer with 60-70 slides. The presentation is also very flexible. The basic outline is given, and if you follow the outline you should do fine.

reviews.author: yaya
reviews.title: Good course to learn and earn a good grade
reviews.comment_content: Its about managing technology and how successful companies did innovation well, some successful, unsuccessful people, and company's mindsets. Some business strategy used in analysing a company externally as well as internally
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Hong is a really nice professor. Although some contents are quite boring, most of the contents and examples are really intriguing, which is really out of my expectation!:)
reviews.comment_grading: I have really paid hard work in this summer course, yet, I only got a B+. Maybe its because there are REALLYREALLY hard-working guys in my class?! I aimed A range, as I thought I have did well in both the group presentation and final exam. It is really easy for the final exam, which consists only MCQs and fill in the blanks. But I am quite disappointed about the grading. We know nothing about our marks for presentation and final exam:(
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is zero, you just have to concentrate when you are having lesson, and attend all of it, as professor will randomly take attendance during class, or even at the end of the class. For the group presentation, 8people per group, but just maximum 3 people will present, but there are peer evaluation. So, make sure you do your best in the preparation period!

reviews.author: 數學研究生
reviews.comment_content:
Since I studied in the winter semester, it is unfair for me to give you the correct content for you if you are going to take this course in the fall/ spring semester.

There are seven power points that professors gave to us. The content includes why we need to have innovation, examples about innovations, how to conduct innovations, qualifications that need to conduct an innovation, timing, some models and analysis.

Easy to learn, since you don't need to remember anything at all, the power points are full of examples which you don't need to memorize at all.

Actually, the professor only taught a few key words, like knowledge, timing that common sense things, that's why a lot of people want to take this course, since the content is very very easy. You can just go to the lecture and listen some interesting stories.
reviews.comment_teaching:
As you know that our professor is a Korean, he is a very funny guy who always makes us laugh during the lesson. Actually, he will not read from his power-points which makes me being concentrated in his speaking. He gives a lot of examples for students to think of, like mobile phones, IBM, Microsoft etc. He also talks a lot of example like his experiences and his life in HK etc.

His power-points are interesting too. Sometimes, he puts some Chinese wordings in his power-points like 知己知彼，百戰不殆. As I said before, the professor always asks me questions. Once he asked me to teach him Cantonese in some Chinese Wordings. HAHA, he learnt very fast and pronounced it clearly and accurately.

Sometimes, there is some bad words in his speaking which makes us laugh, such as axxholes, fxxking etc. LMAO
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't know, since I still did not receive any marks from the TA. Unknown marks for presentations and final exams. But it seems that everyone can get very high marks. Since I was sitting at the beginning of the classroom, Professor asked me a lot of questions, it seems that he is a nice guy and easy to give you high marks. I talked to him for several times, he told me that everyone can get 90 or above out of 100 marks in the final exam. And the presentation, he did not give any marks during the presentations, he just listened how the students introduce the topic and present. He said everyone did as well as he thought.

BTW, he divided us into twelve groups and there were seven to eight people in a group. We can choose some people to give the presentation but not necessary for all the group-mates to do the presentation. This is a good way for you to work as a group.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light, since I was studying it in the winter semester. A long period of lessons but actually you do not need to do a lot of things outside the classroom. Since there is only a project you need to work with 7-8 people. You know, 7-8 people work for only ONE project, you can think about it.

reviews.author: ivylamwingsze
reviews.title: Technology and Innovation: Social and Business Perspectives
reviews.comment_content:
There are total 6 notes.
Each one is very easy, if you have common sense and attend the class, you will understand them well.
This course is about innovation, how a technology companies be so successful, what is their strategy.
But I think the content is a little bit boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Although the content is boring,but professor Hong is very good. He is a Korean, and gives a lot of interesting example to help us understand the theory well. Each class has a 10 minutes break.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think if your exam result is mean, you can got b range.
attendance 5% (actually prof. only took twice in this semester )
presentation 20% (a group with 7 students, but it is not necessary that all group members present in the class. The topic and the presentation had better to be interesting. )
peer evaluation 15%
final exam 60%
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite low. No assignment in winter semester. All things you need to work on is a presentation and final exam. And the presentation topic is technology company. So it is not too hard to prepare.

reviews.author: sebieeee
reviews.comment_content: You do not really get to learn much about anything practical. However, there are a tons of case studies and examples about how big tech companies in the world now became big tech companies. Just a bunch of very chill stuffs.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor would share a lot of examples and case studies during the class. He would get very excited if you would talk to him about those examples. Attendance would be taken irregularly - he would take attendance in 5 lectures, with no pattern at all.
reviews.comment_grading: I received a pretty good grade with relatively little effort. So basically throughout the whole semester you would only need to attend the midterm and final exams, as well as doing a presentation about an innovative company (chosen by your group from a provided list of 50). Midterm and Final exams are chill. I got 1 SD above mean for the midterm. No score of the final exam and the final presentation is given though. I got an A at last.
reviews.comment_workload: Basically everything in the exam are on the lecture slides, just memorize everything to ace the exams. The final presentation is easy as well, you will just have to analyze how the company your group chose grow and given some hints of the future direction that the company is going for. You could definitely find everything you need within 5 Google searches. You do not need to make the presentation slides very fancy, but do remember to polish up your presentation skills.

reviews.author: LUCY
reviews.comment_content: The content is really interesting. He combined theoretical knowledge and examples together. Since the course is about innovation. So he gave us lots of innovative companies and their products, which really broaden my mind. And in the latter study, I mean in other courses. I use lots of knowledge I learned from this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: His English is really good! And of course, the class is really full, not easy to get enrolled.
reviews.comment_grading: I got A, but I think it's not easy to get high-grade in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a little bit heavy. There are midterm, final, and project which include report and presentation. But the presentation is really freestyle, not very difficult. The difficult part is the report, around 30 pages.

reviews.author: W76
reviews.title: An easy class
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting and it stimulated my interest in start-ups and innovations. A lot of examples and case studies were given so you can better understand the concepts. This course is not difficult as long as you go to class and read the materials given by him. There are also lecture videos so if you miss the class you can still catch up.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is  very chill. He loves to ask questions/answer questions. If you are are more active in class, he will give you a higher participation marks (out of 7) which can affect your grade quite a lot.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite reasonable. I got below 2 SD for mid term, and above 1 SD for final and above mean for group project and I still got a B range (forgot whether I got B or B+).
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is alright. There is one group project, one simulation, one mid term and one final. If you study all the materials given by him (lecture notes, readings, videos), you can basically get an above mean score in exams.

reviews.author: hyhuiaa
reviews.comment_content: The course content is really interesting. It started by describing the basic concepts of innovation for the first part. After that, the course talks about how the society adopts and protects innovation. At the end, it will walk through the process that innovative company turns an idea into a real product.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is really passionate. As there will be case distributed in class for class discussion, he is able to guide students to think from multiple perspectives.
reviews.comment_grading:
The basic mark distribution is as follow:
10%- Class participation
*There will be bonus mark for the active students (e.g. the final marks may be 11%, 12% or 13％ etc.)
*Try to answer more question during the class as Prof. will ask quite a number of questions during the lesson and after in-class case discussion
20%- Midterm exam
30%- Project (20% report + 10% present)
40%- Final exam
(10 MCQs, 10T/F, 7 short essay-type questions, 3 Case in three hours)

Class participation 12% but Final 89%
Overall 96% -> A+
reviews.comment_workload: There is no quiz and you don`t need to read the case in advance. The group project is the only workload that you will have in the semester.

reviews.author: ivanmak
reviews.title: Technology and Innovation
reviews.comment_content: Useful content, talking about how innovation impacts different companies nowadays. A lot of case studies and concepts to learn from this course. It is useful for people who wants to start-up or work in the technology sector.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was very great. He encouraged a lot of debates and discussion during the class. We learnt a lot from those case studies.
reviews.comment_grading:
class participation 10%
midterm 25%
final 40%
project (report) 25%
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not hard as long as we participate in class and online forum. Need to memorise some contents for the exams though because there was no cheat sheet.

reviews.author: Phill
reviews.title: Best teacher so far must take!
reviews.comment_content: Regarding technology and innovation.  There would be a group project regarding how businesses adopt the innovative DNA by the end of the semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: He would include a lot of case studies regarding real-world business practices and how businesses implement innovation inside business operations. In class discussions as well as mini class activities would be made.
reviews.comment_workload: Its quite packed but to be honest, if you take it during a regular semester, I do not think that it would be as packed as the winter semester. Anyways, with you just attending his classes, I think its safe to say you have covered 80% of what would be covered in his final examination.

reviews.author: HenryTai
reviews.title: Good course for technophile
reviews.comment_content: It covers a lot of interesting topics of technological advances. If you love to know about the evolution and growth pattern of technologies. This course would be your undoubted choice.This course describes the development of technology and innovation from social and business perspectives. It covers the technology side of innovations, how an invention can be developed into a successful commercial product, the role of innovation in society and how innovations are created from a socioeconomic perspective.
reviews.comment_teaching: The course is instructed in a very interactive manner. There will be a lot of fun in-class exercise.
reviews.comment_grading: I got a B+. It is lower than I expect. However, I think, if you work moderately hard, you can already get good grades. If you really want good grades, some say you can take it during winter semester. It is said to be offering better grades.
reviews.comment_workload: You would expect midterm and final as normal courses but it does not have any assignments. All you need is to engage in the class, ask questions and play around with teammates. This course is moderate.

reviews.author: qctarget
reviews.title: A MUST-TAKE COURSE XD
reviews.comment_content:
This course describes the evolution of technology from different perspectives. It also covers some theories for students to understand the development more deeply.
Course materials were easy to understand.

***Back to the days when I was attending this course, Prof. once played a video in class, (unluckily I skipped that class), then the video was covered by the final exam. He did not upload it or post the link to lmes as far as I remember, so avoid skipping class or else you are sacrificng your grade lol
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Jeevan was good at explaining the flow of logic. He also did well in answering students' questions. Plus, he emphasized the importance of class contribution.

(PS. he didn't allow us to use any electronic device in lesson)
reviews.comment_grading:
Good Grade!
As long as you have participation in class, score not too low (around mean level), and your project is not too flop, I guess you can at least obtain a B. But if you do more than what I mentioned, I think A-range is an easy job.
My advice is, try to participate in class as much as you can.


---------------------------For reference----------------------------
For me, I had active participation. I scored quite high marks for midterm (>1 or 1.5 SD higher than mean) , but I did not perform too well in the final (>0.5 SD higher than mean). My project was 28/30. Eventually I got an A, whereas my teammate who score slightly higher than me in the final exam got an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not many things to do.
Only a project (with proposal, ppt and report)
Other than that I did not have to do anything.

But if you do some revisions or preparations, then it's easier for you to get bonus mark from Jeevan when you answer his question.

By the way ,forgot whether there is reading material or not.

reviews.author: Yangers
reviews.comment_content:
This courses focuses on technology and innovation in a social and business perspective.

Through the implementation of various modern-day case studies, topics that include dynamics of technological innovation, the concept of network effects and platforms, open innovation/crowdsourcing platforms and product development are discussed throughout the semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Kim is an engaging and passionate professor. He creates a lecture environment where discussion and friendly debate is encouraged. His lecture presentations are well prepared with creative visual graphics.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair, with the majority weighted on the midterm and final exams. Nevertheless, group projects and participation can both help boost your overall grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is relatively high, as one needs to juggle their time to fit both exam revision and a group project presentation and report. In-class participation is strongly encouraged, but if one is not willing to do so they can participate in the wiki discussions online.

reviews.author: pytsangaa
reviews.title: Isom 1380 review
reviews.comment_content: 內容簡單 考試只要睇番佢REVIEW既NOTES就OK, D題目基本上REVIEW講左俾你知 呢科只要背野就OK 另外GROUP PROJECT唔駛全組出去PRESENT 所以如果有FD/夾得到 基本上只係做好自已戈PART就輕鬆完SEM
reviews.comment_teaching: PROFESSOR D口音有少少怪 但份人都幾有趣 上耐D就會聽得慣
reviews.comment_grading: MID TERM FINAL ABOVE MEAN 半SD, PROJECT唔知, 最後B
reviews.comment_workload: MID TERM FINAL PROJECT,考試就係背, 唔算多野, PROJECT自己揀TOPIC, 自由度都大, REPORT每人除番開寫少少. 都OK

reviews.author: Crystal FU
reviews.title: 可推薦
reviews.comment_content: 個人感覺內容還比較有趣，每節課prof都會講很多案例和故事。innovation的定義、分類，business & social impacts，進入business的發展過程，對innovation的估值，各種進入時間的利弊，Substitutes和Complements的影響 etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: prof非常幽默風趣，課堂氣氛也比較活潑，三個半小時的課都很少覺得無聊打瞌睡，人很和善。韓國教授但是英語很不錯，幾乎沒有口音。暑假exchange student略多。
reviews.comment_grading: 自我感覺presentation做得還不錯，final也不難，但是每次走堂都恰好記attendance…最後B+，也就這樣啦
reviews.comment_workload: 只有final和presentation，沒有homework也沒有quizzes，workload真心不大，有記attendance，不要求課堂發言

reviews.author: Nicnic
reviews.comment_content: Very interesting content about current social innovtion, such as google glass, apple wallet. Many concepts with examples
reviews.comment_teaching: Very interactive, encouraging teacher. Willing to answer students question.
reviews.comment_grading: Grade is ok if you are willing to revise. Midterm is quite easy if u revise. Exam is more difficult. It is easy to get high marks in the group project.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not so heavy, just a project about an innovative company, have to give presentation and write a report. Online discussion is required every week, it is a about the topic discussed during lesson.

reviews.author: Benjamin Hui
reviews.title: 又Hea又好Grade
reviews.comment_content:
五份ppt，全部圍繞住Technology innovation。
入門水平，任何背景既同學都輕易理解，不過如果讀過相關既IS course就可能有D concept都幾重複。
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. 係每年暑假黎UST專教呢一個course。教左好似十年？所以對material既了解係絕對既，成日講故仔，如果唔係都吹唔到三個半鍾堂。佢份人有學識有經驗又風趣，有好多唔同既個案分享，成日吹到自high，好鍾意問exchange student，所以local唔洗驚。
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Attendance/Participation: 5%
Group Assignment: 35% (peer evaluation 10% included)
Final Examination: 60%

Attendance take 左兩次，完左Add drop 一次，最尾個堂一次，點名take（咁就去左半個鐘），prof認得人所以幫唔到人take。

Grouping 自己分，第一堂好似會全班一個個咁自介（因為ＰＲＯＦ唔想教書），如果無朋友既搵組應該都易既，一組都成６－８個。
題目今年係介紹一種新既technology，the most impact the best，最緊要係同學聽得明，睇落覺得型，同你自己知道自己講咩。盡量有幾新得咁得，唔好比Ｄ幾年前既youtube人睇，同學/prof 睇過哂一定悶死，自然爛grade。(10%peer evaluation嘛)

Final 完左冇分佈，所以完全唔知點grade。

最後拎A+，同組都有兩個A range。
reviews.comment_workload:
上堂三個半鍾，一星期三堂上四個星期，好似好多，不過走堂無壓力，最緊要睇番Notes，考既全部係ppt有齊。

Presentation 開左兩次會，一次決定topic，第二次分工做野。實際做一日完哂。Exchange-in Engine Teammate 英文唔好拎cue card照讀無問題。

Final 睇哂5份PPT，入到去全MC，T/F，輕鬆，應該好多人90%以上，所以要小心，但係workload上係無得彈。

reviews.author: Binlo
reviews.comment_content:
If you are interested in technology, this course suits u. Some business concepts were included in this course, if you are not familiar with them, you might get confused sometimes. Asking questions during lectures, Google and Youtube would be your best friends.

Content of the lecture:
L1: Dynamics of Technological Innovation
L2: The Emergence of Dominant Designs and Network Effects
L3: The chicken-or-egg problem
L4: How to solve the chicken-or-egg problem
L5: Innovation Experimentation
L6: Innovation Competition and Winner-Take-All market
L7: Open Innovation and Crowdsourcing
L8: Disruptive Innovation
L9: Disruptive Innovation
L10: Final exam
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Kim is super nice, he constantly replies to the chat in Zoom, as people are super active. He explains every concept clearly and straight to the point, you can ask him questions through email, fast response from him.
reviews.comment_grading:
Prof Kim's grading is very gentle, if you submit on time and complete the tasks, he usually gives you an A range grading.
The mean of projects is high.
reviews.comment_workload:
Prof Kim's lecture includes a few short quizzes (2 mc per quiz) after class, they help you to recall the content that he had gone through. But to my surprise, there were roughly 3 group works (2 projects and 1 in-class game) and 1 final exam (30 sth MCs and 3 long Qs). The group works are 2 ppt presentations, tbh, the workload of this summer class is a little bit heavy, but they are easy to deal with, no worries. Just try your best and most of the groups get good grades.

For the final exam, I strongly recommend you spend some time revising the content of the course, as you only have roughly 4 weeks of lectures. The has a certain level of difficulty, make sure you are prepared if you want to score high.

reviews.author: DR.WHO?
reviews.title: Interesting cc for tech ppl
reviews.comment_content:
The content and concepts in this course is simple and straightforward.
1. Why innovation happened?
2. Types of innovation
3. How new disruptive technologies be adopted?
4. How to protect your innovations (e.g. patents, copyrights, trade secrets, etc.)
5. Agile development
Etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is so willing to provide concrete examples of how the theories and concepts in this course can be applied in the real world.
For example, how Kodak was disrupted by DSLR, how ssd replaced hdd and other legacy storage devices.
reviews.comment_grading:
DISTRIBUTION:
1. Class Participation 15
2. Mid-Term Exam 30 (83.5/100) mean: 65 sd: 11.9
3. Group Project 40
- Presentation (15) (14/15)
- Report (25) (23.5/25)
4. Term Paper (Individual) 15

Overall Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Although there is a project in this course, the project is fun and should not be a burden to you. My group wrote about how Elon Musk develop new technologies by using the terms in this course. I think this project will be fun and easy for ppl who like and aware of new tech.

Finally, the personal term paper is about researching a new tech that should be FASCINATING enough. Again it’s simple and straightforward!

reviews.author: DrainGang
reviews.title: Nice
reviews.comment_content:
Very general ideas about companies and innovations, some bordering on common sense, not very useful but somewhat interesting.

1. The Importance and Sources of Technological Innovation
2. Patterns and Dynamics of Technological Innovations
3. Standards Battles and Network Externalities
4. Timing of Entry
5. Defining the Strategic Direction for Technological Innovation
6. Open Innovation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Surprisingly good teaching, considering the lecture contents, 3 3-hour long lectures per week.

The professor gives quite a lot of interesting stories about companies and their stories, since it's all online you can consider the lectures a technology-related podcast (an unintentionally funny one because he would occasionally describe products as "shitty" and companies as "assholes"), attendance is required but since its Zoom just join the call.

He also gives some well-needed breaks during the lectures, 3 breaks per lecture, each 15 minutes long, quite nice!
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes (30%): 5 quizzes on CANVAS, 6 questions each. Quite easy as the most (other than 1 particularly odd question) questions are copied verbatim from the lecture notes, CTRL+F is your friend.

Group Project (30%): in 7 people groups, make a 12 minute long presentation on an innovative company, the professor specifically said we should make it about less-known companies and yet most groups presented very popular companies. Highly dependent on your groupmates abilities on presenting and making powerpoints.

Group Assignment (Case analysis) (10%): In the same group, make a 15 page long powerpoint analyzing/summarizing a paper regarding innovation in Siemens, the paper is quite long, but not too difficult to read, again this is highly dependent on your groupmates abilities.

Individual Assignment (5%): Summarize a long essay about disruptive products, the essay is quite long and boring, however summarizing it is not particularly hard.

Peer Evaluation (20%): Rate your groupmates with IPeer! Since this is worth 20% of the grade its clear you MUST pay effort in the groupwork, otherwise you will pay.

Class Attendance (5%): Just attend the lectures.

As you can see the groupwork is a huge part of the course, and the groups are assigned RANDOMLY, but you are bound to get a few groupmates from the business school, who can help a lot with the presentation! However as with all group projects there is an element of luck involved.

No grades were released, very nontransparent grading. I got an A- and I think my performance was just average, so good grading perhaps?
reviews.comment_workload:
For a winter semester 3 credit course, its quite nice, this course is a great way to fulfill the SSC-SA requirement.

No finals is particularly good, and while there are multiple group projects and assignments, they are not super difficult and half of the work is making your powerpoint look good, which the business students should help quite a lot with. Assuming you don't have any freeriders, you most likely just need to make a few pages of powerpoints throughout the course, which for 3 credits is amazing.

reviews.author: Shubham
reviews.comment_content: You learn about interesting stuff like technology and innovation in the context of social and business perspective.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good teacher. Teaches with passion and is interesting to listen to.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good, you need to know the concepts well and use buzz words during the exam

There is class participation, mid term, presentation, report and final
reviews.comment_workload:
High workload for a common core course

For class participation you have to participate very frequently, pretty much every single class otherwise you will not get a good grade.Group project were standard but still quite time consuming

reviews.author: yahoohi
reviews.comment_content: Study on innovation and technology examples
reviews.comment_teaching: Often use different case study for student to understand the related topics or concept. Frequent open-floor Q & A for students to answer to his questions.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair but quite harsh on marking.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are no quizzes.
There are only Mid-term exam and Final Exam which are close book exams. It require you to memorize different concepts and analyzed the cases given in the papers.
Moreover, i also require a group project for you to study on some innovative companies about their working cultures

reviews.author: firstsnow
reviews.comment_content:
1.Intro: Technology and Innovation: Social and Business Perspectives
2. The Importance and Sources of Technological Innovation
3. Patterns and Dynamics of Technological Innovations
4. Standards Battles and Network Externalities
5. Timing of Entry
6. Defining the Strategic Direction for Technological Innovations
6. Open Innovation
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Hong is funny and has lots of stories and own experience to share. He explains the concepts and topics detailedly. However, his speaking pace is a bit slow.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes: 30%
Group Presentation: 30%
Group Assignment: 15%
Individual Assignment: 5%
Class Participation/Peer Evaluation: 20%
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost each lesson has a small quiz which consists of 6 MC or fill in the blank questions. Quite easy if you have listened to him during the class.
Good groupmates are important as group projects weigh quite a lot in this course.

reviews.author: Summus
reviews.title: low workload and the content is fun
reviews.comment_content:
1: Introduction, The Importance of Technological Innovations
2: Continue “The Importance of Technological Innovations”
3: Creativity
4:Patterns of Technological Innovations
5:Standards Battles and Network Externalities
6:Continue “Standards Battles and Network Externalities”
7:Defining the Strategic Direction for Technological Innovation
8:Continue “Defining the Strategic Direction...”
9:Open Innovations
10:Team Presentations
11:Continue “Open Innovations”
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor have prepared lots of story on different business company. He explain the concept via example and the material is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good. I think most of the student get B+ or above
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fair.
Quizzes: 30%
Group Project: 30%
Group Assignment (Case analysis): 15%
Individual Assignment: 5% Class Attendance/Peer E valuation: 20%

Almost small quiz each lesson, only 6 MC and the question is quiet straightforward.

reviews.author: llchan
reviews.title: Boring class bad grading
reviews.comment_content:
The content is interesting. Real life examples are used to explain the course content. The content is about how creative ideas should be generated within an organisation, types of innovation around the world, how timing affect the product cycle.

Attendance is important, group work which professor will randomly assign group-mates. Peer evaluation needed. The group work is about one of the 50 smartest companies in 2017. No quizzes. No midterm. Just Final.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring.
I know Hong has try to keep us awake by using his own examples, usually the failed ones, still my mind drift away...
reviews.comment_grading: I don't have a good grade but I guess there is something wrong with the final and the group work. Other group use SWOT to analysis the company's outlook but not for us. So that's why my grade is not good.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all but it depends on the group-mates that you are talking to. For my group, there are always 11 am meetings among us to finish the work.

reviews.author: Mew
reviews.comment_content:
The content was pretty interesting, talking about innovations by various companies. As an ISOM course, it focused quite a bit on the business side of things.

Some of the things covered were technology diffusion, strategic analysis (like Porter's 5 force model), advantages of different organizational structures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor was pretty good. He managed to make 3.5-hour classes not unbearably boring. He doesn't mind if you do something on your laptop/phone.

There is an attendance component so if you don't want to miss that you are forced to attend. This year he took attendance 4 times in a row (out of 10ish classes).
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Attendance
10% Peer Evaluation
15% Group Presentation
60% Final

The grading was very good. None of the scores were released, except the attendance score which could be inferred, but overall it seems pretty easy to do well.

The final was just 40 MCs (40 points, 1 point each), 5 T/F questions (10 points, 2 points each), and 5 fill in the blanks (10 points, 2 each). The group mates I spoke to after the final agreed with me that it was not too difficult. If you look over the slides and listen to the lectures, the MCs and T/Fs should be easy for the most part. The fill in the blank questions might be a bit easier to miss, they mainly wanted a keyword for the answer.

I had full attendance, my presentation went (IMO) pretty well, I found the final easy and got A+ in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: Just attendance, a presentation, and a final. It's a pretty good deal especially in summer where there are only 7 powerpoints you have to memorize for the final.

reviews.author: Piyusha
reviews.title: ISOM - 1380
reviews.comment_content:
The content of the course is very informative as you get to learn new concepts.
You have to take notes yourself on the lecture notes provided by the instructor.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is quite good and makes sure he explains the concepts properly. There are a few activities midst the classes to make to understand the concepts clearly. Even though the activities might not be very entertaining, they for sure make to relate to the concepts and remember them during the exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
The TA sticks to the Marksheet and even if your answer is right but is not according to the points in the mark-sheet he will not give marks.
Your performance is mostly based on your memorizing skills.The mean for the course is quite high, so it is necessary not to lag behind.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not much if you go through the lecture slides and your notes regularly However, there is a group project and group presentation, so you need to make sure that you team up with the right people. Also it is necessary to participate in the class/ class discussions and it counts towards 10% of your grade.

reviews.author: ustspace123
reviews.comment_content: It covers a lot of famous case studies in the course, which is helpful in our learning and.. just makes everything more interesting, as you must have seen those things in your day to day life, the case studies tell you where they come from and how they were born. The course also analyses innovation trends and how it interacts with the market.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Jeevan teaches with responsibility, he answers student's questions very willingly and has an easy-followed logic.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance 10%
Mid-term Exam 20%
Group Project 30%
Final Exam 40%
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of work, the project could be a pain, hope you get responsible groupmates.

reviews.author: Emilyyy
reviews.comment_content:
Content is interesting and useful
8 chapters in total:

1. Innovation Types and Technology S-curves & Cycle
2. Dominant Design and Network Effects
3. Chicken-and-Egg Problem
4. Platform Competition and Winner-take-all-market
5. Innovation Experimentation
6. Open Innovation and Crowdsourcing
7. Disruptive Innovation I
8. Disruptive Innovation II
reviews.comment_teaching:
funny and nice guy
Professor did a great job in teaching. Even though the lectures are long (3.5 hours), professor Hong still managed pretty well. He gave us plenty of breaks and funny moments.
reviews.comment_grading:
very good grade
got a
reviews.comment_workload: presentation and no final due to covid19

reviews.author: Abcalan
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content: 個course教既野非常簡易基本，學既野唔太深入。雖然成個course教innovation，但好似唔係好學到野。。
reviews.comment_teaching: 每堂三個鐘，但prof時間都控制得不錯，令同學聽得幾留心
reviews.comment_grading: 個grade真係非常好，不過prof無講明大家final exam 同group project 幾分，感覺上a range 不太難。。
reviews.comment_workload: 1 final exam, 1 group project (presentation only)

reviews.author: Zeus
reviews.comment_content: Content is interesting, would suggest people in year 1or 2 to take it, it's a fun common core to take when you're starting uni. The material isn't hard to understand, he discusses everything in detail during class and the book isn't required either. Make lots of notes!
reviews.comment_teaching: Jeevan Jaisingh is awesome! He keeps the classes interesting and interactive, and has group activities planned during some of the sessions.
reviews.comment_grading: Scoring in the exams isn't hard. So the mean tends to get pretty high. Nevertheless, if you've made notes during lectures you're probably going to get way above the mean. To be on the safe side, I would say mean+sd gets you A or A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much, as long as you listen in class and make notes, you should be fine for the exam.

reviews.author: Philosophy_Cat
reviews.comment_content:
1 Sep 2 Introduction to Course  
2 Sep 7 Innovation Evolution and S-Curves    
3 Sep 9 Patterns of Innovation in Different Industries  
4 Sep 14 Innovation Adoption  
5 Sep 16 Technology Ethics  
6 Sep 21 Innovation and the Impact on Labor Market, Form groups
7 Sep 23 Protecting Innovation: Patents  
8 Sep 28 Protecting Innovation: Copyrights, Trademarks and Trade-secrets
9 Sep 30 Promoting Innovation: The Role of Public Policy  
10 Oct 5 Organizing for Innovation, Get instructor’s approval for topics
11 Oct 7 Review for mid-term examination    
Oct 12 MID TERM EXAM

13 Oct 19 Analyzing Innovation Capabilities  
14 Oct 21 Finding Innovative Ideas  
15 Oct 26 Developing Innovations

19 Nov 9 Crowdsourcing
20 Nov 11 Project consultation
21 Nov 16 PROJECT PRESENTATIONS
22 Nov 18 PROJECT PRESENTATIONS
23 Nov 23 PROJECT PRESENTATIONS
24 Nov 25 Review for final examination
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very passionate and engaging in teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% class participation
20% midterm exam
30% group project (10% presentation, 20% report)
40% final exam

I guess the grading is good since I didn't register the course. You should however pay attention to the 10% class participation.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is extremely light for me since I didn't register the course.
